Gangon eyed BrightBlade with shock and pain.

"No! What did you do to her!? Get her to a CR Chamber, NOW! Or I will fire!"
Gangon said to Grimmler and the rest of the Maximals atacking BrightBlade...
----- Original Message -----
From: "Moon Mist" <shadowwarrior_ax@...>
To: <nbwrpg@egroups.com>
Sent: Friday, August 18, 2000 4:31 AM
Subject: Re: Brigth Blade's Way Out



* The shoot was almost in range, just a few more feet!
All of a sudden BrightBlade found herself smacked against the wall, the
laser weapon shot from Grimmler striking its mark.
She slid to the floor and laid there, unmoving while she began to will
herself to get up again.
Her escape was so close; she had to get to it!
There was nothing she could do while she was pummeled by the blasts sent by
Firearm as he charged, simply laid there and tried not to scream her head
off from the pain.
Her body was basically junked, most of her systems offline already. But with
the amount of damage she had sustained, she was surprised that she wasn't in
stasis lock yet.
But she stayed there, unmoving for a few more moments. Knowing that the
Maximals were getting closer and would be upon her in seconds.
With a strangled groan she tried to haul herself onto her hands and knees
again, but just fell to the ground again with a disdainful whimper.
But then, with a last desperate act of will, she began to pull herself
towards the shaft with her hands. Her going even slower now. But it was SO
close.
With one last pull of her arm she came to the shaft opening, snaking in her
hand and opening the door that covered it.
BrightBlade let out a whimper at what she saw and sank to the ground, her
head finally resting on her hands.
There was a bar over the entrance to the shaft, cutting it off so that there
wasn't a chance in the Pit that she could get through.
If she had been stronger she would have just reefed the bar out and went
through the shaft, but she wasn't.
And now there was nowhere to run no more exits that were close by.
She was trapped there, exhausted and utterly defeated. Her wounds bled
deeply upon the floor and made it slick with her fluid, her systems slowly
fading into the final act.stasis lock.
BrightBlade simply stayed there and waited for the Maximals to arrive,
probably ready to blow her head off and there was nothing that she could do.
But she would get out, if it took a million years she would get out.
She only had to wait.
Time would be on her side. *
